text: I'd like to show you one of my favorite
fall soups this is a Portuguese style
spicy sausage and kale soup a little bit
of potato in there and I think you're
going to really enjoy this I actually
stole this soup from a diner in San
Francisco called grub steak which is a
famous after-hours hangout and it's run
by a Portuguese family and they got the
burgers and the sandwiches but on the
back of the menu they got two or three
of their native family specialties from
Portugal and this is one of them and
it's really good and I think you're
going to enjoy it not a lot of
ingredients but a lot of flavor step 1
here I just want you to dice up an onion
all right I'm going to go kind of a
medium to a large dice here you don't to
be too fine with this I didn't even take
out the root end like I usually do the
sausage I'm using is actually a spanish
chorizo so I guess I just turned this
into a Spanish soup but the original
dish uses a Portuguese linguist if you
want to use a hot Italian sausage at
work also very well any spicy sausage is
going to work alright so don't worry too
much about that the spice is to me an
important flavor component if you had to
I guess you could use a mild sausage but
if I really like this the Spanish Teresa
it's got the garlic paprika in it very
nice flavor all right we don't need a
lot of oil because the sausages has a
lot of fatness this is just to get this
sauteing started so I have my stock pot
on medium and I want you to take your 1
diced onion and I had 12 ounces of
sausage and just put that over a medium
flame and just start sweating those down
all right don't really want a lot of
color on it you just basically softening
those onions the garlic press I did 2 3
cloves of garlic so add that in the
onions have already cooked for about
five minutes and next you're going to
take one extra large russet if you can't
find extra large russet you're going to
use two medium size russet and don't use
any kind of red or waxy potato for this
just the texture won't be the same you
need that real starchy mealy russet
style potato for this to work I threw in
my potato and I'm just going to cover
that with a quart of chicken
stop okay these little chicken stock
cartons and like the best invention of
the last five years love this stuff you
can reseal them I'm actually to put in
the whole quart there and about the same
amount of water it's three or four cups
of water and I'm just going to put that
on a medium to low simmer and basically
I'm just going to wait till the potatoes
soften in the meantime there's my
delicious kale if you've never had kale
hey this is a great excuse to try it
you've walked by it in the produce
section all those years so grab a bunch
you're going to cut it across into about
inch sized pieces again this is really
gonna just like a spinach just really
wilts down to almost nothing when it
hits the hot liquid so just give the
whole bunch of chopped now if you find
any of these stems from the bottom you
can pull those out those actually will
cook down also so it's not a big deal
and there's the entire bunch I got it
soaking in some water just sometimes
there's a little bit of grit or sand so
I like to give it a good rinse and we
might as well make this a little healthy
I know you don't have to do this but
it's recommended you can skim off the
tree so fat from the top and there we go
so we're almost finished here how I know
it's done I press that potato against
the side and if it smashes and it seems
soft you're ready to mash and I just
take a potato masher you can use a spoon
for this and just break up those
potatoes it's going to seem really thin
when you first do this but then the
potato starch will start to thicken
again it's not a potato chowder it's not
a potato soup the potato just gives a
little bit of a silky texture and I
added all my kale and basically just
simmer that until the kale is tender I'm
going to say about 10 to 15 minutes so
put in my soup bowl I like to finish
with a little small dollop of sour cream
which is smoothes it out a little bit
and some nice Spanish paprika and to me
that is just a fantastic fall soup it's
a little bit spicy again the potato
gives a nice silky texture I think
you're really going to enjoy this
